text: Python: How expensive is to create a small list many times?
I encounter the following small annoying dilemma over and over again in Python:
) if called many times since a_list get re-created for each call of do_something()

code:
def do_something():    
  a_list = ["any", "think", "whatever"]    
  # read something from a_list

text: Uglier but more efficient (spare the a_list creation all over again)

code:
a_list = ["any", "think", "whatever"]    
def do_something():    
  # read something from a_list
